thread.title: Angola: Vietnam Wants to Support Government's Policy On Economic Diversification
thread.title_full: Angola: Vietnam Wants to Support Government's Policy On Economic Diversification

title: Angola: Vietnam Wants to Support Government's Policy On Economic Diversification
text:
West Africa: Could the World Bank Solve Boko Haram? 
Luanda — The Socialist Republic of Vietnam wants to support Angolan Government policies focused on diversification of economy, development and increased jobs, said Friday in Luanda the deputy prime minister of the Republic of Vietnam, Hoang Trung Hai. 
The official, who was speaking on the sidelines of the signing of a Declaration of Friendship between the provinces of Benguela and Danang, with a view to strengthening cooperation, stressed that the intention is to continue to focus on diversification and economic stabilization of Angola, as well as Vietnam growth. 
On the other hand, he praised the contribution of the country to peace and stability in Africa during its presidency of the Council for Peace and Security of the African Union and at the International Conference on the Great Lakes Region, and as a non-permanent member of the UN Security Council. Angola
